classDescription: Someone has to play the healer.

textElements.regularText:
During combat the Priest deepens his connection with the Aether and they use that connection to empower their spells or other magical abilities.
During the battle you will aquimulate Aether Dice which are d6. These dice represent the current Aether dice pool, the lower the value the more they represent good and the higher the values the more they represent Evil. During the battle these dice can change and additional dice are added.

bulletPoints: At the start of each of the Priest’s turn he receives ona Aether dice of random value.
Falling Unconcious removes all current Aether Dice.

textElements.regularText: The Priest also gains additional Aether Dice depending on their Allignment

bulletPoints: Good: The first time during a [ROUND] you heal an ally or grant a positive status effect, you gain one Aether Dice equal to d3.
Evil: The first time during a [ROUND] you damage an enemy or inflict a negative status effect on them you gain one Aether Dice equal d3+3.
Lawful: The first time during a [ROUND] you succeed a [SAVE] or remove a status effect from a creature you gain one Aether Dice you already have, if you have none none you can choose one.
Chaotic: The first time during a [ROUND] you turn a [D20 TEST] from a failure to a success or from a success to a failure, you gain a random aether dice.
Partial Neutral: You can trigger the ability of your other allignment twice per [ROUND].
True Neutral: You gain an additional Aether Dice at the start of your Turn.

textElements.regularText: The following Notation is used for describing Aether Dice (AD) and desired Values:

bulletPoints: AD = Any Aether Dice
AD(1) = Aether Dice with a value of 1
AD(4+) = Aether Dice with a value of 4 or higher (4-6)
AD(3-) = Aether Dice with a value of 3 or lower (1-3)

textElements.regularText: The Warrior Priest not only fights with their supernatural abilites, but also martial skills and leadership qualities
Zealots have strong Idiological and moral beliveves and set themselves on a path of rightous crusading.

The Mystic attempts to find explanations for the universe, they are able to see any viewpoint and thus are the closes to achieve full understanding of the cosmos. A Mystic's alignment must be True Neutral
If you are of good allignment, you gain access to the Divine Blessing ability. If you are of evil allignment you gain the Divine Curse ability. If you are neutral, you gain access to both.

ability.name: Divine Blessing
ability.description: A number of friendly creatures up to half your [CHA] (rounded down, minimum 1) recieve [THP] equal to your [SPI] and they recieve [BLESS I]

ability.name: Unholy Curse
ability.description: You can target up to half your [CHA] , minimum 1 (rounded down) creatures. Make a [SPI] [SPELL TEST] against their [WILLPOWER] on a success they recieve unholy damage equal to your [SPI] and the [BANE I] status effect.

textElements.regularText: The Warrior Priest gains the following benefits:

bulletPoints: You gain 2 additional [HP] per [LEVEL]
You gain a [MARTIAL LEVEL] Progression of 1/3.
You can learn martial maneuvers of the types Leader and Weapon.

textElements.regularText: The Mystic gains the following benefits:

bulletPoints: [INT] is now a class Attribute for you (Increase attribute maximum or current).
For the purposes of recieving certain bonuses, interacting with abilites or meeting requirements you count as having any allignment. Additionally you can't recieve penalties due to your alignment
At the start of any battle choose one moral or idialogical alignment besiedes Neutral. You can now also recieve Aether Dice as if you had that alignment.

textElements.regularText: The more Aether Dice you have the stronger the Aether influences the Battle.

bulletPoints: If you have 2 AD(1) then increase the healing of any ability you use by your [LEVEL] and increase the duration of postive Status Effects you grant by 1 [ROUND]. For each additional AD(1) increase the healing by [LEVEL]/2 and the duration by 1 further.

If you have 2 AD(6) then increase the damage of any ability you use by your [LEVEL] and increase the duration of negative Status Effects you grant by 1 [ROUND]. For each additional AD(1) increase the damage by [LEVEL]/2 and the duration by 1 further..
If you have 3 matching AD then you recieve a +1 bonus to any [SAVE] you make. For any further matching dice increase the bonus by 1.

If you have 4 unique then once per [ROUND] if you make a [D20 TEST] you can adjust the result by +[LEVEL] or -[LEVEL], for every additional unique dice you can do this one additional time per [ROUND].

textElements.regularText: The Priest is able to perform minor miracles as long as they keep their faith. These miracles can’t generally be used in combat and take concentration and a clear mind to perform. They gain the following ability:

ability.name: Minor Miracle
ability.description:
You invoke a minor miracle, choose one of the effects below:
Provide tasty food and drink for up to 20 people.
Heal a crature up to full [HP].
End all Tier 1 and 2 negative status effects affecting a Crature.
Restore 2 Stamina to all party members.
Alternative Miracle effect agreed if agreed by the GM.

After usage, Miracle recovery [DT] is 25.

textElements.regularText: Each time the Priest uses a Miracle Ability they can’t do so it any more. Once at the start of each day they make a prayer and make a [DT] 25 [SPI] [ATTRIBUTE TEST] which can’t be modified in any other way, on a success they can use miracles again. They can repeat the Test each following day where they reduce the [DT] by 5 until they succeed. Alternatively if the Priest Character acts well within their believes or played well the GM may grant them the Miracle again without rolling.
Each time you receive an Aether Dice, you gain an additional one.
The Priest has exceptional faith in his believes and fears no danger. The Priest can use a half of their [SPI] for calculating [STABILITY], [DODGE] and [TOUGHNESS] instead of [STR] [AGI] and [CON].
The Priest is now able to perform greater miracles in addition to the ones he can already do:

ability.name: Miracle
ability.description:
You invoke a miracle, choose one of the effects below:
Provide tasty food and drink for a village.
Heal your party to full [HP].
End all negative status effects affecting a Creature.
Restore 5 [STAMINA] to all party members.
Alternative Miracle effect agreed if agreed by the GM.

After usage, Miracle recovery [DT] is 50..

textElements.regularText: The Priest is now able to perform even greater miracles in addition to the ones he can already do:

ability.name: Miracle
ability.description:
You invoke a miracle, choose one of the effects below:
Provide tasty food and drink for a town.
Restore a creature to life which has died within the last hour.
Restore all [STAMINA] of your party.
Summon a cosmic to assist you
Alternative Miracle effect agreed if agreed by the GM.

After usage, Miracle recovery [DT] is 100.

textElements.regularText: The Priest is able to perform mighty acts that rival the power of a god-like being, these can be performed regardless if they are eligble to perform a miracle or not:

bulletPoints: If the Priest died or they soul became trapped or bound they can use this ability and come back alive with their soul being returned to them. Talk with the GM on how they came back.

They can sacrifice themselves and matyr for their allies or cause. When doing so they can’t be resurrected with their soul now being bound to the aether. For this sacriface they can alter reality in a major way they wish, examples: Forever bind an evli entity somewhere, reverse the destruction of a major city, ....

textElements.regularText: When performing such an act, they can’t do so again.

classTechniques.name: Lingering Healing
classTechniques.target: one ally that was targeted by a [SPELL ABILITY]
classTechniques.description: One ally that was targeted with a [SPELL ABILITY] that you cast this turn recieves [HEALING I].

classTechniques.name: Holy Strike
classTechniques.description: When you hit a target with an [ATTTACK] you can deal 2d6 extra holy damage. For every additional AD(3-) used, you can increase the holy damage by a further d6.

classTechniques.name: Mercy of the Gods
classTechniques.cost: 0 [AP], nubmer of AD(2-) equal to spell power
classTechniques.description: For your next [SPELL ABILITY] that you cast, that heals you can maximize all dice.

classTechniques.name: Rejuvination
classTechniques.description: That ally regains 1 [HP] and can immediatly stand up from being [PRONE] if they are able to move.

classTechniques.name: Holy Fire
classTechniques.description: [SPI] [SPELL TEST] vs. [DODGE]. On success: [SPI]*d6 holy damage. On fail: half damage.

classTechniques.name: Unholy Strike
classTechniques.description: When you hit a target with an [ATTTACK] you can deal 2d6 extra unholy damage. For every additional AD(4+) used, you can increase the unholy damage by a further d6.

classTechniques.name: Unholy Fire
classTechniques.description: [SPI] [SPELL TEST] vs. [DODGE]. On success: [SPI]*d6 unholy damage. On fail: half damage.

classTechniques.name: Divine Clense
classTechniques.description: You can remove one Tier I status effect affecting the Target. When this ability is used with 4 matching AD Tier 2 Status Effects can be removed. When used with 6 matching AD Tier 3 status effects can be removed.

classTechniques.name: Protection
classTechniques.description: If an ally within range recieves damage you can use this Ability and reduce the damage by [SPI] + [LEVEL].

classTechniques.name: Certainty
classTechniques.description: For the next [D20 TEST] you make don’t roll a dice, instead it is a unmodified roll of 10. When this ability is used with 3 matching AD the roll becomes a 16 and when used with 4 matching AD the roll becomes a 20.

classTechniques.name: Sanctified Shackles
classTechniques.description: [SPI] [SPELL TEST] vs. [STABILITY] or [DODGE] (target’s choice). On success: apply [RESTRAINED I]. If targeting a chaotic creature you have [ADVANTAGE] on the Test

classTechniques.name: Unyielding
classTechniques.description: When you fail a [SAVE] you can use this Ability and add your [LEVEL] to the result potentially turning it into a success.

classTechniques.name: Second Chance
classTechniques.description: After a creature made a [D20 TEST] you can use this Ability and the creature must reroll the test and take the second result.
